page.title: 03Roundshaw Past
page.content:
Twenty years ago the area that is now the Roundshaw Estate was grassland. There were many quite rare wildflowers including an orchid that conservation- ists were particularly interested in. In summer the air was filled with the sound of skylarks hovering over nests and kestrals swooping for fieldmice. There were many foxes in this area who used to wander the surrounding roads and gardens;foxes have not been seen for three or four years now. It was said that there was a badger set in the woods bordering Foresters Drive.
By Roundshaw School
